title: Ticket #1714: Condor should bring back files on job remove boundaries
description:
A feature proposal from a user at OSG:

When a job gets removed via PERIODIC_REMOVE, it should at least bring back whatever stdout and stderr files were available in either the job execution directory, if the job was executing when this fired, or from the intermediate spool, if the job was idle or on hold already.

Consequently, if a user issues condor_rm, any stdout or stderr files should be brought back as well.

It is debatable if an arbitrary amount of files can be specified to be brought back under these conditions, but the initial files supported by the feature should be stdout/stderr.
